text: The Okapi Wildlife Reserve () is a wildlife reserve in the Ituri Forest in the northeast of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It is near the country's borders with South Sudan and Uganda. It covers roughly one-fifth of the area of the forest. In 1996, the Okapi Wildlife Reserve was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It was listed because of its big population of endangered okapis and its high biodiversity. ==References== Category:Geography of the Democratic Republic of the Congo Category:World Heritage Sites in Africa
title: Okapi Wildlife Reserve
